docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Balloon is a modernized and sophisticated tooltips library for Android, fully customizable with an arrow and animations. It supports both traditional Android Views and Jetpack Compose, making it versatile for any Android project.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Fully Customizable: Configure arrow position, size, orientation, colors, text, icons, and more
  • Rich Animations: Support for fade, overshoot, elastic, and circular reveal animations
  • Highlight Animations: Heartbeat, shake, breath, and rotate animations while displayed
  • Overlay Support: Highlight anchor views with customizable overlay shapes
  • Jetpack Compose Support: Native Compose integration with Modifier.balloon() API
  • Lifecycle Aware: Automatically dismisses when activity/fragment is destroyed
  • Persistence: Show tooltips only once or a specific number of times
  • Sequential Display: Chain multiple balloons to show sequentially

docs.title: Who's using Balloon?
docs.text:
Balloon hits +800,000 downloads every month around the globe!

Featured on Google Dev Library

Balloon is featured on the Google Dev Library, recognized for its quality and usefulness in the Android development community.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Add the dependency below to your module's build.gradle file:

GroovyKotlin 
dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon:$version")
}

dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon:$version")
}

For Jetpack Compose, add the compose dependency:

GroovyKotlin 
dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon-compose:$version")
}

dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon-compose:$version")
}

docs.title: Android Views
docs.text:
val balloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setWidthRatio(1.0f)
    .setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
    .setText("Edit your profile here!")
    .setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    .setTextSize(15f)
    .setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
    .setArrowSize(10)
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f)
    .setPadding(12)
    .setCornerRadius(8f)
    .setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.skyBlue)
    .setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC)
    .setLifecycleOwner(lifecycleOwner)
    .build()

// Show the balloon
balloon.showAlignTop(anchorView)

docs.title: Jetpack Compose
docs.text:
val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setArrowSize(10)
    setArrowPosition(0.5f)
    setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
    setWidth(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
    setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
    setPadding(12)
    setCornerRadius(8f)
    setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.skyBlue)
    setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC)
}

val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(builder)

Button(
    modifier = Modifier.balloon(balloonState) {
        Text(text = "Edit your profile here!")
    },
    onClick = { balloonState.showAlignTop() },
) {
    Text(text = "Show Balloon")
}

docs.title: Animation
docs.text: Balloon supports various animations for showing, dismissing, and highlighting tooltips.

docs.title: Balloon Animation
docs.text:
These animations play when the Balloon is shown and dismissed.

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC)

docs.title: Available Animations
docs.text:
BalloonAnimation.NONE // no animation
BalloonAnimation.FADE // fade in/out
BalloonAnimation.OVERSHOOT // overshoot effect
BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC // elastic bounce
BalloonAnimation.CIRCULAR // circular reveal

docs.title: Preview
docs.text: FADE OVERSHOOT ELASTIC CIRCULAR

docs.title: Highlight Animation
docs.text:
These are repeating animations that play while the Balloon is displayed, drawing attention to the tooltip.

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBalloonHighlightAnimation(BalloonHighlightAnimation.SHAKE)

docs.title: Available Highlight Animations
docs.text:
BalloonHighlightAnimation.NONE // no highlight animation
BalloonHighlightAnimation.HEARTBEAT // pulsing effect
BalloonHighlightAnimation.SHAKE // shaking effect
BalloonHighlightAnimation.BREATH // breathing effect
BalloonHighlightAnimation.ROTATE // rotation effect

docs.title: Preview
docs.text: HEARTBEAT SHAKE BREATH ROTATE

docs.title: Rotate Animation Configuration
docs.text:
Customize the rotate animation with additional options:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBalloonHighlightAnimation(BalloonHighlightAnimation.ROTATE)
    .setBalloonRotationAnimation(
        BalloonRotateAnimation.Builder()
            .setLoops(2)
            .setSpeeds(2500)
            .setTurns(INFINITE)
            .build()
    )

docs.title: Overlay Animation
docs.text:
Control the animation of the overlay:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBalloonOverlayAnimation(BalloonOverlayAnimation.FADE)

docs.title: Available Overlay Animations
docs.text:
BalloonOverlayAnimation.NONE // no overlay animation
BalloonOverlayAnimation.FADE // fade in/out (default)

docs.title: Animation Duration
docs.text:
Customize animation durations for circular reveal animation:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setCircularDuration(500L) // duration in milliseconds

docs.title: Custom Animations
docs.text:
You can use custom animation resources:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBalloonAnimationStyle(R.style.CustomBalloonAnimation)

Define your custom animation style in styles.xml:

<style name="CustomBalloonAnimation" parent="android:Animation">
    <item name="android:windowEnterAnimation">@anim/custom_enter</item>
    <item name="android:windowExitAnimation">@anim/custom_exit</item>
</style>

docs.title: Arrow
docs.text: This guide covers how to customize the arrow on your Balloon tooltips.

docs.title: Basic Arrow Configuration
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setIsVisibleArrow(true) // show or hide the arrow
    .setArrowSize(10) // arrow size in dp
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f) // position ratio (0.0 ~ 1.0)
    .setArrowOrientation(ArrowOrientation.BOTTOM) // arrow direction
    .setArrowDrawable(ContextCompat.getDrawable(context, R.drawable.arrow)) // custom drawable

docs.title: Arrow Orientation
docs.text:
The arrow orientation determines which side of the Balloon the arrow appears on:

ArrowOrientation.TOP // arrow points upward
ArrowOrientation.BOTTOM // arrow points downward
ArrowOrientation.START // arrow points to the start (left in LTR)
ArrowOrientation.END // arrow points to the end (right in LTR)
TOP BOTTOM START END

docs.title: Arrow Position
docs.text:
The setArrowPosition method uses a ratio value from 0.0 to 1.0 to determine where the arrow is placed along the Balloon edge.

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f) // center
    .setArrowPosition(0.2f) // 20% from the start
    .setArrowPosition(0.8f) // 80% from the start

docs.title: Arrow Position Rules
docs.text: You can choose how the arrow position is calculated:

docs.title: ALIGN_ANCHOR
docs.text:
The arrow position is calculated relative to the anchor view:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f) // arrow will be at the center of the anchor

docs.title: ALIGN_BALLOON
docs.text:
The arrow position is calculated relative to the Balloon body:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_BALLOON) // default
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f) // arrow will be at the center of the Balloon

docs.title: Arrow Orientation Rules
docs.text: You can choose how the arrow orientation is determined:

docs.title: ALIGN_ANCHOR (Recommended)
docs.text:
The arrow orientation adapts based on available screen space:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowOrientationRules(ArrowOrientationRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR) // default

For example, if you set ArrowOrientation.TOP and call showAlignBottom, but there's not enough space below the anchor, the Balloon will be shown above the anchor and the arrow orientation will automatically change to BOTTOM.

docs.title: ALIGN_FIXED
docs.text:
The arrow orientation is fixed and does not change:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowOrientationRules(ArrowOrientationRules.ALIGN_FIXED)

docs.title: Fixed Size
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowSize(10) // 10dp

docs.title: Wrap Content
docs.text:
The arrow size matches the original drawable resource size:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowSize(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)

docs.title: Arrow Color
docs.text:
The arrow color is automatically set to match the Balloon background color. You can also set a custom arrow drawable:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowDrawableResource(R.drawable.custom_arrow)
    .setArrowColorResource(R.color.custom_arrow_color)

docs.title: Arrow Constraints
docs.text:
You can add left and right padding constraints to the arrow:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowLeftPadding(10) // minimum distance from left edge
    .setArrowRightPadding(10) // minimum distance from right edge

docs.title: Arrow Elevation
docs.text:
Add elevation to the arrow for shadow effect:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowElevation(4f)

docs.title: Customization
docs.text: This guide covers various customization options for Balloon tooltips.

docs.title: Background Color
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBackgroundColor(Color.BLACK)
    .setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.skyBlue)

docs.title: Corner Radius
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setCornerRadius(8f)

docs.title: Alpha (Transparency)
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setAlpha(0.9f) // 0.0 to 1.0

docs.title: Stroke (Border)
docs.text:
Add a stroke (border) to the Balloon container and arrow:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setBalloonStroke(
        color = Color.WHITE,
        thickness = 4f
    )

docs.title: Elevation and Shadow
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setElevation(6f)

docs.title: Focusable
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setFocusable(true) // gains focus when shown

docs.title: Dismiss When Clicked
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setDismissWhenClicked(true) // dismiss when Balloon is clicked

docs.title: Dismiss When Touched Outside
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setDismissWhenTouchOutside(true) // dismiss when touching outside

docs.title: Dismiss When Shown Again
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setDismissWhenShowAgain(true) // dismiss current if show is called again

docs.title: Dismiss When Lifecycle Destroyed
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setDismissWhenLifecycleOnPause(true) // dismiss on onPause

docs.title: Pass Touch Events to Anchor
docs.text:
Allow touch events on the Balloon to pass through to the anchor view:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setPassTouchEventToAnchor(true)

docs.title: RTL Support
docs.text:
Enable right-to-left layout support:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setIsRtlLayout(true)

docs.title: Status Bar Visibility
docs.text:
Control whether the Balloon appears above or below the status bar:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setIsStatusBarVisible(true)

docs.title: Preferences Name
docs.text:
Set a unique name for persistence features:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setPreferenceName("my_balloon")

docs.title: Measured Size
docs.text:
Get the measured dimensions of the Balloon:

val width = balloon.getMeasuredWidth()
val height = balloon.getMeasuredHeight()

docs.title: Content View Access
docs.text:
Access the internal content view for advanced customization:

val contentView: ViewGroup = balloon.getContentView()
val arrowView: View = balloon.getBalloonArrowView()

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide covers the basics of creating and displaying Balloon tooltips in your Android application.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Add the dependency below to your module's build.gradle file:

GroovyKotlin 
dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon:$version")
}

dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon:$version")
}

docs.title: Using Balloon.Builder
docs.text:
You can create a Balloon instance using the Balloon.Builder class:

val balloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setWidthRatio(1.0f)
    .setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
    .setText("Edit your profile here!")
    .setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    .setTextSize(15f)
    .setIconDrawableResource(R.drawable.ic_edit)
    .setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
    .setArrowSize(10)
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f)
    .setPadding(12)
    .setCornerRadius(8f)
    .setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.skyBlue)
    .setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC)
    .setLifecycleOwner(lifecycleOwner)
    .build()

docs.title: Using Kotlin DSL
docs.text:
You can also create a Balloon using the Kotlin DSL with createBalloon:

val balloon = createBalloon(context) {
    setWidthRatio(1.0f)
    setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
    setText("Edit your profile here!")
    setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    setTextSize(15f)
    setIconDrawableResource(R.drawable.ic_edit)
    setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
    setArrowSize(10)
    setArrowPosition(0.5f)
    setPadding(12)
    setCornerRadius(8f)
    setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.skyBlue)
    setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC)
    setLifecycleOwner(lifecycleOwner)
}

docs.title: Using Java
docs.text:
Balloon balloon = new Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setArrowSize(10)
    .setArrowOrientation(ArrowOrientation.TOP)
    .setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f)
    .setWidth(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
    .setHeight(65)
    .setTextSize(15f)
    .setCornerRadius(4f)
    .setAlpha(0.9f)
    .setText("You can access your profile from now on.")
    .setTextColor(ContextCompat.getColor(context, R.color.white))
    .setIconDrawable(ContextCompat.getDrawable(context, R.drawable.ic_profile))
    .setBackgroundColor(ContextCompat.getColor(context, R.color.colorPrimary))
    .setOnBalloonClickListener(onBalloonClickListener)
    .setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.FADE)
    .setLifecycleOwner(lifecycleOwner)
    .build();

docs.title: Width and Height
docs.text: You can adjust the width and height of the Balloon using various approaches.

docs.title: Specific Size
docs.text:
Set specific sizes regardless of the content:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setWidth(220) // sets 220dp width
    .setHeight(160) // sets 160dp height

docs.title: Wrap Content
docs.text:
Set dynamic sizes depending on the content:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setWidth(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP) // width depends on content
    .setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP) // height depends on content

docs.title: Screen Ratio
docs.text:
Set width based on the screen size ratio:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setWidthRatio(0.5f) // 50% of the horizontal screen size

docs.title: Padding
docs.text:
Adjust the content padding inside the Balloon:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setPadding(6) // 6dp padding on all sides
    .setPaddingLeft(8) // 8dp left padding
    .setPaddingTop(12) // 12dp top padding
    .setPaddingRight(8)
    .setPaddingBottom(12)

docs.title: Margin
docs.text:
Add margins to the Balloon container:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setMargin(12) // margin on all sides
    .setMarginLeft(14)
    .setMarginRight(14)
    .setMarginHorizontal(14) // left and right margins

docs.title: Lifecycle Management
docs.text:
To avoid memory leaks, always set the lifecycle owner. The Balloon will automatically dismiss when the activity or fragment is destroyed:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setLifecycleOwner(lifecycleOwner)

Important

Always set the lifecycle owner to prevent memory leaks. Dialog and PopupWindow can leak memory if not properly dismissed before the activity is destroyed.

docs.title: Lazy Initialization
docs.text:
You can initialize a Balloon lazily using the balloon() extension and a Balloon.Factory:

class CustomActivity : AppCompatActivity() {
    private val profileBalloon by balloon<ProfileBalloonFactory>()
}

Create a factory class that extends Balloon.Factory:

class ProfileBalloonFactory : Balloon.Factory() {

    override fun create(context: Context, lifecycle: LifecycleOwner): Balloon {
        return createBalloon(context) {
            setLayout(R.layout.layout_custom_profile)
            setArrowSize(10)
            setArrowOrientation(ArrowOrientation.TOP)
            setArrowPosition(0.5f)
            setWidthRatio(0.55f)
            setHeight(250)
            setCornerRadius(4f)
            setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.background)
            setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.CIRCULAR)
            setLifecycleOwner(lifecycle)
        }
    }
}

Note

The factory class must have a default (no-argument) constructor.

docs.title: Listeners
docs.text: Balloon provides various listeners to respond to user interactions and lifecycle events.

docs.title: Balloon Click Listener
docs.text:
Triggered when the user clicks on the Balloon content:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonClickListener { view ->
        // handle balloon click
    }

docs.title: Balloon Overlay Click Listener
docs.text:
Triggered when the user clicks on the overlay area:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonOverlayClickListener {
        // handle overlay click
    }

docs.title: Dismiss Listener
docs.text:
Triggered when the Balloon is dismissed:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonDismissListener {
        // handle balloon dismiss
    }

docs.title: Initialization Listener
docs.text:
Triggered after the Balloon is fully initialized and laid out:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonInitializedListener { view ->
        // balloon is ready
    }

docs.title: Balloon Touch Listener
docs.text:
Handle touch events on the Balloon content:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonTouchListener { view, motionEvent ->
        // handle touch event
        true // return true if consumed
    }

docs.title: Outside Touch Listener
docs.text:
Triggered when the user touches outside the Balloon:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonOutsideTouchListener { view, motionEvent ->
        // handle outside touch
    }

docs.title: Overlay Touch Listener
docs.text:
Handle touch events on the overlay:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonOverlayTouchListener { view, motionEvent ->
        // handle overlay touch
        true // return true if consumed
    }

docs.title: Setting Listeners After Building
docs.text:
You can also set listeners after building the Balloon:

val balloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setText("Hello World!")
    .build()

balloon.setOnBalloonClickListener { view ->
    // handle click
}

balloon.setOnBalloonDismissListener {
    // handle dismiss
}

docs.title: Listeners with Interfaces
docs.text:
For Java or when you need a more structured approach, use the listener interfaces:

balloon.setOnBalloonClickListener(object : OnBalloonClickListener {
    override fun onBalloonClick(view: View) {
        // handle click
    }
})

balloon.setOnBalloonDismissListener(object : OnBalloonDismissListener {
    override fun onBalloonDismiss() {
        // handle dismiss
    }
})

docs.title: Chaining Show with Dismiss Listener
docs.text:
A common pattern is to show another Balloon when one is dismissed:

val firstBalloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setText("First tooltip")
    .setOnBalloonDismissListener {
        secondBalloon.showAlignBottom(anchor)
    }
    .build()

val secondBalloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setText("Second tooltip")
    .build()

firstBalloon.showAlignBottom(anchor)

docs.title: Overlay
docs.text: Balloon supports displaying an overlay over the entire screen except for the anchor view, creating a spotlight effect that highlights the anchor.

docs.title: Basic Overlay
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setIsVisibleOverlay(true)
    .setOverlayColorResource(R.color.overlay)
    .setOverlayPadding(6f)
    .setOverlayPaddingColorResource(R.color.colorPrimary)
    .setBalloonOverlayAnimation(BalloonOverlayAnimation.FADE)
    .setDismissWhenOverlayClicked(false)

docs.title: Overlay Shapes
docs.text: You can customize the shape of the highlighted area around the anchor.

docs.title: Oval (Default)
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayShape(BalloonOverlayOval)

docs.title: Circle
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayShape(BalloonOverlayCircle(radius = 36f))

docs.title: Rectangle
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayShape(BalloonOverlayRect)

docs.title: Rounded Rectangle
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayShape(BalloonOverlayRoundRect(12f, 12f))

You can also set individual corner radii:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayShape(
        BalloonOverlayRoundRect(
            topLeftRadius = 8f,
            topRightRadius = 8f,
            bottomLeftRadius = 16f,
            bottomRightRadius = 16f
        )
    )

docs.title: Preview
docs.text: OVAL CIRCLE RECT ROUNDRECT

docs.title: Overlay Position
docs.text:
Set a specific position for the overlay shape:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayPosition(Point(x, y))

docs.title: Overlay Animation
docs.text:
BalloonOverlayAnimation.NONE
BalloonOverlayAnimation.FADE // default

docs.title: Overlay Padding
docs.text:
Add padding around the highlighted area:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOverlayPadding(8f) // padding in dp
    .setOverlayPaddingColorResource(R.color.paddingColor) // padding color

docs.title: Dismiss When Overlay Clicked
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setDismissWhenOverlayClicked(true) // dismiss balloon when overlay is clicked

docs.title: Overlay Click Listener
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonOverlayClickListener {
        // handle overlay click
    }

docs.title: Overlay Touch Listener
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setOnBalloonOverlayTouchListener { view, event ->
        // handle overlay touch
        true // return true if handled
    }

docs.title: Multiple Anchors
docs.text:
You can display the overlay with multiple anchors highlighted:

balloon.showAlign(
    align = BalloonAlign.TOP,
    mainAnchor = mainView,
    subAnchorList = listOf(secondaryView1, secondaryView2),
    xOff = 0,
    yOff = 0
)

docs.title: Persistence
docs.text: Balloon supports persisting show counts to control how many times a tooltip is displayed. This is useful for onboarding flows where you only want to show tips a limited number of times.

docs.title: Show Count Limit
docs.text:
Set a maximum number of times the Balloon should be shown:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setPreferenceName("my_tooltip")
    .setShowCounts(3) // show only 3 times

With this configuration, the Balloon will only be displayed the first 3 times showAlign* is called. After that, the Balloon will not show.

docs.title: Check if Should Show
docs.text:
Before showing, you can check if the Balloon should be displayed based on the show count:

if (balloon.shouldShowUp()) {
    balloon.showAlignBottom(anchor)
}

The shouldShowUp() method returns true if the show count hasn't been reached yet.

docs.title: Clear Preferences
docs.text:
Reset the show count for a specific Balloon:

balloon.clearAllPreferences()

This clears all persisted data for the Balloon, allowing it to be shown again.

docs.title: Preference Name
docs.text:
Each Balloon that uses persistence should have a unique preference name:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setPreferenceName("unique_tooltip_name")
    .setShowCounts(1) // show only once

The preference name is used as a key to store the show count in SharedPreferences.

docs.title: BalloonPersistence
docs.text:
For advanced use cases, you can access the BalloonPersistence singleton directly:

val persistence = BalloonPersistence.getInstance(context)

// Check if should show
val shouldShow = persistence.shouldShowUp("tooltip_name", 3)

// Manually increment count
persistence.putIncrementedCounts("tooltip_name")

// Clear all preferences
persistence.clearAllPreferences()

docs.title: One-Time Tooltips
docs.text:
A common use case is showing a tooltip only once:

val onboardingBalloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setText("This is a new feature!")
    .setPreferenceName("feature_onboarding")
    .setShowCounts(1)
    .build()

// This will only show the first time
onboardingBalloon.showAlignBottom(anchor)

docs.title: Showing Balloon
docs.text: This guide covers the various ways to display and dismiss Balloon tooltips.

docs.title: Display Methods
docs.text: You can show the Balloon using different alignment methods. Each method positions the Balloon relative to an anchor view.

docs.title: Align Top
docs.text:
Shows the Balloon above the anchor view:

balloon.showAlignTop(anchor) // shows above the anchor
balloon.showAlignTop(anchor, xOff, yOff) // with offset

docs.title: Align Bottom
docs.text:
Shows the Balloon below the anchor view:

balloon.showAlignBottom(anchor) // shows below the anchor
balloon.showAlignBottom(anchor, xOff, yOff) // with offset

docs.title: Align Start
docs.text:
Shows the Balloon at the start (left in LTR) of the anchor view:

balloon.showAlignStart(anchor) // shows at start
balloon.showAlignStart(anchor, xOff, yOff) // with offset

docs.title: Align End
docs.text:
Shows the Balloon at the end (right in LTR) of the anchor view:

balloon.showAlignEnd(anchor) // shows at end
balloon.showAlignEnd(anchor, xOff, yOff) // with offset

docs.title: As Dropdown
docs.text:
Shows the Balloon as a dropdown below the anchor:

balloon.showAsDropDown(anchor) // shows as dropdown
balloon.showAsDropDown(anchor, xOff, yOff) // with offset

docs.title: At Center
docs.text:
Shows the Balloon overlapping the anchor at its center:

balloon.showAtCenter(anchor) // shows at center
balloon.showAtCenter(anchor, xOff, yOff, BalloonCenterAlign.TOP)

docs.title: Kotlin Extensions
docs.text:
You can also use Kotlin extension functions on views:

myButton.showAlignTop(balloon)
myButton.showAlignBottom(balloon)
myButton.showAlignStart(balloon)
myButton.showAlignEnd(balloon)

docs.title: Immediate Dismiss
docs.text: balloon.dismiss()

docs.title: Dismiss with Delay
docs.text: balloon.dismissWithDelay(1000L) // dismisses after 1 second

docs.title: Auto Dismiss
docs.text:
Set the Balloon to automatically dismiss after a duration:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setAutoDismissDuration(1000L) // auto dismiss after 1 second

docs.title: Sequential Display
docs.text: You can show multiple Balloons sequentially using relay methods or coroutines.

docs.title: Using Relay Methods
docs.text:
customListBalloon
    .relayShowAlignBottom(customProfileBalloon, circleImageView)
    .relayShowAlignTop(customTagBalloon, bottomNavigationView, 130, 0)

// Start the sequence
customListBalloon.showAlignBottom(anchorView)

docs.title: Using Coroutines
docs.text:
coroutineScope.launch {
    customListBalloon.awaitAlignBottom(anchorView)
    customProfileBalloon.awaitAlignBottom(circleImageView)
    customTagBalloon.awaitAlignTop(bottomNavigationView, 130, 0)
}

Note

The relayShow__ and await__ methods overwrite the setOnDismissListener internally, so you cannot use setOnDismissListener at the same time.

docs.title: Update Position
docs.text:
You can update the Balloon's position while it's displayed:

balloon.updateAlignTop(xOff, yOff)
balloon.updateAlignBottom(xOff, yOff)
balloon.updateAlignStart(xOff, yOff)
balloon.updateAlignEnd(xOff, yOff)
balloon.update(xOff, yOff)

docs.title: Display in DialogFragment
docs.text:
When showing a Balloon inside a DialogFragment, you may need to attach it to the decor frame:

balloon.setIsAttachedInDecor(true)

docs.title: Text and Icon
docs.text: This guide covers how to customize the text and icon content of your Balloon tooltips.

docs.title: Basic Text
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setText("Edit your profile here!")
    .setTextSize(15f)
    .setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    .setTextGravity(Gravity.START)
    .setTextTypeface(Typeface.BOLD)

docs.title: HTML Text
docs.text:
If your text contains HTML tags, enable HTML rendering:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setText("<b>Bold</b> and <i>italic</i> text")
    .setTextIsHtml(true)

docs.title: Auto-Sized Text
docs.text:
Enable auto-sizing to fit text within the Balloon window:

Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setTextSize(15f)
    .setMinAutoSizeTextSize(14f)
    .setMaxAutoSizeTextSize(18f)
    .setEnableAutoSized(true)

Note

Ensure the maximum auto text size is higher than the minimum auto text size.

docs.title: TextForm
docs.text: TextForm allows you to create reusable text configurations that can be applied to multiple Balloons.

docs.title: Create TextForm
docs.text:
Kotlin BuilderKotlin DSLJava 
val textForm = TextForm.Builder(context)
    .setText("Edit your profile here!")
    .setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    .setTextSize(14f)
    .setTextTypeface(Typeface.BOLD)
    .build()

val textForm = textForm(context) {
    setText("Edit your profile here!")
    setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    setTextSize(14f)
    setTextTypeface(Typeface.BOLD)
}

TextForm textForm = new TextForm.Builder(context)
    .setText("Edit your profile here!")
    .setTextColorResource(R.color.white)
    .setTextSize(14f)
    .setTextTypeface(Typeface.BOLD)
    .build();

docs.title: Apply TextForm
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setTextForm(textForm)

docs.title: Basic Icon
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setIconDrawableResource(R.drawable.ic_edit)
    .setIconSize(20) // icon size in dp
    .setIconSpace(10) // margin between icon and text
    .setIconColorResource(R.color.white)
    .setIconGravity(IconGravity.START) // START, END, TOP, BOTTOM

docs.title: Icon Gravity
docs.text:
Control where the icon appears relative to the text:

IconGravity.START // icon on the left (LTR)
IconGravity.END // icon on the right (LTR)
IconGravity.TOP // icon above text
IconGravity.BOTTOM // icon below text

docs.title: IconForm
docs.text: IconForm allows you to create reusable icon configurations.

docs.title: Create IconForm
docs.text:
Kotlin BuilderKotlin DSLJava 
val iconForm = IconForm.Builder(context)
    .setDrawable(ContextCompat.getDrawable(context, R.drawable.arrow))
    .setIconColor(ContextCompat.getColor(context, R.color.skyblue))
    .setIconSize(20)
    .setIconSpace(12)
    .build()

val iconForm = iconForm(context) {
    setDrawable(ContextCompat.getDrawable(context, R.drawable.arrow))
    setIconColor(ContextCompat.getColor(context, R.color.skyblue))
    setIconSize(20)
    setIconSpace(12)
}

IconForm iconForm = new IconForm.Builder(context)
    .setDrawable(ContextCompat.getDrawable(context, R.drawable.arrow))
    .setIconColor(ContextCompat.getColor(context, R.color.skyblue))
    .setIconSize(20)
    .setIconSpace(12)
    .build();

docs.title: Apply IconForm
docs.text:
Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setIconForm(iconForm)

docs.title: Custom Layout
docs.text:
For complex layouts, you can use a custom layout file:

val balloon = Balloon.Builder(context)
    .setLayout(R.layout.layout_custom_balloon)
    .setArrowSize(10)
    .setArrowOrientation(ArrowOrientation.TOP)
    .setArrowPosition(0.5f)
    .setWidthRatio(0.55f)
    .setHeight(250)
    .setCornerRadius(4f)
    .setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.black)
    .setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.CIRCULAR)
    .setLifecycleOwner(lifecycleOwner)
    .build()

docs.title: Access Custom Views
docs.text:
After building the Balloon with a custom layout, you can access the views:

val button: Button = balloon.getContentView().findViewById(R.id.button_edit)
button.setOnClickListener {
    Toast.makeText(context, "Edit clicked", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
    balloon.dismiss()
}

docs.title: BalloonState
docs.text: BalloonState is the primary way to control balloon display in Jetpack Compose. It provides methods for showing, dismissing, and interacting with balloons.

docs.title: Creating BalloonState
docs.text:
Use rememberBalloonState to create a memoized state instance:

@Composable
fun MyScreen() {
    val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
        setText("Hello World!")
    }
    val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(builder)
}

You can also pass an optional key to trigger recomposition:

val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(
    builder = builder,
    key = someKey // recomposes when key changes
)

docs.title: isShowing
docs.text:
Check if the balloon is currently visible:

if (balloonState.isShowing) {
    // balloon is visible
}

docs.title: isAttached
docs.text:
Check if the balloon state is attached to a composable:

if (balloonState.isAttached) {
    // safe to call show methods
}

docs.title: balloon
docs.text:
Access the underlying Balloon instance:

val balloon = balloonState.balloon

docs.title: anchorView
docs.text:
Access the anchor view:

val anchor = balloonState.anchorView

docs.title: Show Aligned
docs.text:
Show the balloon aligned to different positions relative to the anchor:

// Show above the anchor
balloonState.showAlignTop()
balloonState.showAlignTop(xOff = 10, yOff = -5)

// Show below the anchor
balloonState.showAlignBottom()
balloonState.showAlignBottom(xOff = 0, yOff = 10)

// Show to the start (left in LTR)
balloonState.showAlignStart()
balloonState.showAlignStart(xOff = -10, yOff = 0)

// Show to the end (right in LTR)
balloonState.showAlignEnd()
balloonState.showAlignEnd(xOff = 10, yOff = 0)

docs.title: Show at Center
docs.text:
Show the balloon at the center of the anchor:

balloonState.showAtCenter()
balloonState.showAtCenter(
    xOff = 0,
    yOff = 0,
    centerAlign = BalloonCenterAlign.TOP
)

docs.title: Show as Dropdown
docs.text:
Show the balloon as a dropdown below the anchor:

balloonState.showAsDropDown()
balloonState.showAsDropDown(xOff = 0, yOff = 10)

docs.title: Suspend Functions
docs.text:
For coroutine-based control, use the await variants:

LaunchedEffect(Unit) {
    balloonState.awaitAlignTop()
    // continues after balloon is dismissed

    balloonState.awaitAlignBottom()
    // continues after balloon is dismissed
}

docs.title: Dismiss Methods
docs.text:
// Dismiss immediately
balloonState.dismiss()

// Dismiss with delay (returns true if scheduled)
val scheduled = balloonState.dismissWithDelay(1000L)

docs.title: Update Position
docs.text:
Update the balloon position while it's visible:

balloonState.updateAlignTop(xOff = 0, yOff = -10)
balloonState.updateAlignBottom(xOff = 0, yOff = 10)
balloonState.updateAlignStart(xOff = -10, yOff = 0)
balloonState.updateAlignEnd(xOff = 10, yOff = 0)
balloonState.update(xOff = 0, yOff = 0)

docs.title: Listeners
docs.text:
Set listeners on the balloon state:

balloonState.setOnBalloonClickListener { view ->
    // handle click
}

balloonState.setOnBalloonDismissListener {
    // handle dismiss
}

balloonState.setOnBalloonOutsideTouchListener { view, event ->
    // handle outside touch
}

balloonState.setOnBalloonOverlayClickListener {
    // handle overlay click
}

docs.title: Persistence
docs.text:
Check if the balloon should show based on persistence settings:

if (balloonState.shouldShowUp()) {
    balloonState.showAlignBottom()
}

// Clear persisted preferences
balloonState.clearAllPreferences()

docs.title: Measurements
docs.text:
Get the measured dimensions:

val width = balloonState.getMeasuredWidth()
val height = balloonState.getMeasuredHeight()

docs.title: Content View Access
docs.text:
Access the internal views:

val contentView = balloonState.getContentView()
val arrowView = balloonState.getBalloonArrowView()

docs.title: Example with State
docs.text:
@Composable
fun TooltipButton() {
    val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
        setArrowSize(10)
        setArrowPosition(0.5f)
        setBackgroundColor(Color.Gray)
    }
    val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(builder)

    // Set up listeners
    LaunchedEffect(balloonState) {
        balloonState.setOnBalloonDismissListener {
            println("Balloon dismissed")
        }
    }

    Button(
        onClick = {
            if (balloonState.isShowing) {
                balloonState.dismiss()
            } else {
                balloonState.showAlignTop()
            }
        },
        modifier = Modifier.balloon(balloonState) {
            Text("Tooltip text", color = Color.White)
        }
    ) {
        Text(if (balloonState.isShowing) "Hide" else "Show")
    }
}

docs.title: Compose Extensions
docs.text: Balloon provides extension functions for Balloon.Builder that allow you to use Compose Color values directly.

docs.title: Arrow Color
docs.text:
Set the arrow color using a Compose Color:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setArrowColor(Color(0xFF4A90E2))
}

docs.title: Background Color
docs.text:
Set the balloon background color:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setBackgroundColor(Color.DarkGray)
}

docs.title: Text Color
docs.text:
Set the text color:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setTextColor(Color.White)
}

docs.title: Icon Color
docs.text:
Set the icon drawable color:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setIconColor(Color.Yellow)
}

docs.title: Overlay Color
docs.text:
Set the overlay background color:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setOverlayColor(Color.Black.copy(alpha = 0.6f))
}

docs.title: Overlay Padding Color
docs.text:
Set the overlay padding color:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setOverlayPaddingColor(Color.Blue)
}

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
@Composable
fun ThemedBalloon() {
    val primaryColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
    val onPrimaryColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onPrimary
    val surfaceColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surface

    val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
        setArrowSize(10)
        setArrowPosition(0.5f)
        setWidth(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
        setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
        setPadding(12)
        setCornerRadius(8f)

        // Use Compose colors directly
        setBackgroundColor(primaryColor)
        setTextColor(onPrimaryColor)
        setArrowColor(primaryColor)
        setOverlayColor(Color.Black.copy(alpha = 0.5f))
    }

    val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(builder)

    Button(
        onClick = { balloonState.showAlignTop() },
        modifier = Modifier.balloon(balloonState) {
            Text(
                text = "Themed tooltip",
                color = onPrimaryColor,
                modifier = Modifier.padding(8.dp)
            )
        }
    ) {
        Text("Show Balloon")
    }
}

docs.title: Using with Material Theme
docs.text:
The extensions work seamlessly with Material Theme colors:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    val colors = MaterialTheme.colorScheme

    setBackgroundColor(colors.primaryContainer)
    setTextColor(colors.onPrimaryContainer)
    setArrowColor(colors.primaryContainer)
    setOverlayColor(colors.scrim.copy(alpha = 0.5f))
}

docs.title: Alpha Support
docs.text:
Compose colors with alpha channels are fully supported:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setBackgroundColor(Color.Black.copy(alpha = 0.8f))
    setOverlayColor(Color.Black.copy(alpha = 0.4f))
}

docs.title: Jetpack Compose Overview
docs.text: Balloon provides first-class support for Jetpack Compose with a simple and intuitive API using the Modifier.balloon() extension.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Add the Compose dependency to your build.gradle:

dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.skydoves:balloon-compose:$version")
}

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
The recommended way to use Balloon in Compose is with Modifier.balloon():

@Composable
fun MyScreen() {
    val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
        setText("Edit your profile here!")
        setArrowSize(10)
        setArrowPosition(0.5f)
        setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
        setBackgroundColorResource(R.color.skyBlue)
        setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.ELASTIC)
    }
    val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(builder)

    Button(
        onClick = { balloonState.showAlignTop() },
        modifier = Modifier.balloon(balloonState) {
            Text("Tooltip content")
        }
    ) {
        Text("Show Balloon")
    }
}

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
The Compose integration consists of:

  1. rememberBalloonBuilder - Creates a memoized Balloon.Builder
  2. rememberBalloonState - Creates a BalloonState for controlling the balloon
  3. Modifier.balloon() - Attaches a balloon to any composable

docs.title: Balloon Content
docs.text:
The balloon content is defined as a composable lambda:

Modifier.balloon(balloonState) {
    // Any composable content
    Column(
        modifier = Modifier.padding(16.dp),
        horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally
    ) {
        Icon(
            imageVector = Icons.Default.Info,
            contentDescription = null,
            tint = Color.White
        )
        Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(8.dp))
        Text(
            text = "Welcome to the app!",
            color = Color.White
        )
    }
}

docs.title: Showing the Balloon
docs.text:
Use BalloonState methods to show the balloon:

// Show aligned to different positions
balloonState.showAlignTop()
balloonState.showAlignBottom()
balloonState.showAlignStart()
balloonState.showAlignEnd()

// Show at center
balloonState.showAtCenter()

// Show as dropdown
balloonState.showAsDropDown()

docs.title: Dismissing the Balloon
docs.text:
// Dismiss immediately
balloonState.dismiss()

// Dismiss with delay
balloonState.dismissWithDelay(1000L)

docs.title: Compose Color Extensions
docs.text:
Use Compose colors directly with the builder:

val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
    setBackgroundColor(Color(0xFF4A90E2))
    setTextColor(Color.White)
    setArrowColor(Color(0xFF4A90E2))
    setOverlayColor(Color.Black.copy(alpha = 0.5f))
}

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Here's a complete example:

@Composable
fun ProfileScreen() {
    val builder = rememberBalloonBuilder {
        setArrowSize(10)
        setArrowPosition(0.5f)
        setArrowPositionRules(ArrowPositionRules.ALIGN_ANCHOR)
        setWidth(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
        setHeight(BalloonSizeSpec.WRAP)
        setPadding(12)
        setMarginHorizontal(12)
        setCornerRadius(8f)
        setBackgroundColor(Color(0xFF333333))
        setBalloonAnimation(BalloonAnimation.FADE)
    }
    val balloonState = rememberBalloonState(builder)

    IconButton(
        onClick = { balloonState.showAlignBottom() },
        modifier = Modifier.balloon(balloonState) {
            Text(
                text = "Click to edit your profile",
                color = Color.White,
                modifier = Modifier.padding(8.dp)
            )
        }
    ) {
        Icon(
            imageVector = Icons.Default.Edit,
            contentDescription = "Edit"
        )
    }
}
